thread.title: GoodData Sponsors Chief Analytics Officers Summit
thread.title_full: GoodData Sponsors Chief Analytics Officers Summit

author: admin
title: GoodData Sponsors Chief Analytics Officers Summit
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/22/2015 @ 6:00 AM   GoodData 
SAN FRANCISCO, CA -- (Marketwired) -- 10/22/15 -- GoodData ®, the leading provider of business intelligence for data monetization to enterprises and ISVs, today announced it will be a sponsor for the Chief Analytics Officer Summit on October 26 - 27, 2015 at the Bellagio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada. GoodData will join senior IT and business personnel in discussing new approaches for unlocking the value of data in an enterprise by securely distributing it to clients, partners, and other business networks. 
"Companies and, specifically, chief analytics officers, are sitting on a treasure trove of data worth billions of dollars if only they knew how to unlock that value," said GoodData Founder and CEO Roman Stanek. "Beyond governance and access, data is a competitive differentiator and GoodData is committed to enabling companies to monetize these data assets through the distribution of analytics at scale." 
At the Summit, GoodData will lead conversations on the key challenges chief analytics officers face across the enterprise, including monetization, efficiency, innovation, and enablement. Learn more by reading 5 Megatrends Driving the Chief Analytics Officer Role . Since 2012, the International Institute for Analytics (IIA) has presented the Chief Analytics Officer Summit as a forum for business leaders tasked with making their organizations more competitive through the use of advanced analytics. 
What: Chief Analytics Officer Summit 2015 When: October 26 - 27, 2015 Where: Bellagio Hotel and Casino, Las Vegas, Nevada 
For more information on GoodData's participation at the Chief Analytics Officers Summit, please contact events@gooddata.com and learn more about the event here: http://www.gooddata.com/events . 
About Chief Analytics Officer Summit The CAO Summit is a gathering of approximately 200 analytics leaders designed to deliver tangible, thought-provoking strategies and tactics that can be applied to advance any analytics program. The annual CAO Summit focuses on issues that are critical to all organizations, regardless of industry. For more information about the CAO Summit, visit caosummit.com. 
The International Institute for Analytics (IIA) is an independent research and advisory firm for organizations committed to accelerating their business through the power of analytics. Co-founded by Tom Davenport and CEO Jack Phillips, IIA works across a breadth of industries to uncover actionable insights from its network of analytics practitioners, industry experts and faculty. IIA's research clients gain access to an extensive research library, faculty-moderated executive roundtables and phone conversations. IIA also provides analytics benchmarking, dynamic inquiry and advisory services to its members, allowing business leaders and analytics professionals to keep their fingers on the pulse of analytics in the new data economy. Since its inception, SAS, Intel, Teradata, and Dell have supported IIA as underwriters. For more information about IIA, and how you can become a member, visit http://www.iianalytics.com or call 503-467-0210. 
About GoodData GoodData provides groundbreaking BI for data monetization to enterprises, independent software vendors, and system integrators who seek to quickly create and distribute valuable information to large networks of customers and partners. Our real-time analytics distribution platform is highly scalable and secure - allowing companies like Target, Discovery International and Zendesk to deploy engaging data products that are guided by GoodData's expertise in delivering widely-adopted analytics solutions. 
GoodData is headquartered in San Francisco and is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst Partners, Intel Capital, TOTVS and others. For more information, read our blog , visit our website and follow GoodData on Twitter and LinkedIn .
